If A:B = 2:3 and B:C = 4:5, find A:B:C.
questions.explanation:
A:B = 2:3
B:C = 4:5

To combine, make B equal:
A:B = 2:3 = 8:12 (multiply by 4)
B:C = 4:5 = 12:15 (multiply by 3)

A:B:C = 8:12:15

questions.text: The average of 6 numbers is 15. If one number 18 is removed, what is the new average?
questions.explanation:
Sum of 6 numbers = 15 × 6 = 90
After removing 18: New sum = 90 - 18 = 72
New average = 72 / 5 = 14.4

questions.text: If A can complete a work in 12 days and B can complete it in 18 days, in how many days can they complete it together?
questions.explanation:
A's 1 day work = 1/12
B's 1 day work = 1/18
Together = 1/12 + 1/18 = (3+2)/36 = 5/36
Days to complete = 36/5 = 7.2 days

Or using formula: (12 × 18)/(12 + 18) = 216/30 = 7.2 days

questions.text: A train 150 m long crosses a pole in 15 seconds. What is its speed in km/hr?
questions.explanation:
Distance = Length of train = 150 m
Time = 15 seconds
Speed = Distance/Time = 150/15 = 10 m/s
Speed in km/hr = 10 × (18/5) = 36 km/hr

The sum of ages of father and son is 60 years. After 15 years, father's age will be twice the son's age. What is the present age of the son?
questions.explanation:
Let son's age = x, Father's age = 60 - x
After 15 years: Father = 60 - x + 15 = 75 - x, Son = x + 15
Given: 75 - x = 2(x + 15)
75 - x = 2x + 30
45 = 3x
x = 15 years

Prime factorization:
12 = 2² × 3
15 = 3 × 5
20 = 2² × 5

LCM = Product of highest powers = 2² × 3 × 5 = 4 × 3 × 5 = 60

A pipe can fill a tank in 6 hours. Another pipe can empty it in 8 hours. If both are opened together, in how many hours will the tank be filled?
questions.explanation:
Filling pipe rate = 1/6 per hour
Emptying pipe rate = -1/8 per hour
Net rate = 1/6 - 1/8 = (4-3)/24 = 1/24
Time to fill = 24 hours
